item.title: Acraspisoides helviarta
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description: Stilletto fly. So busy and with those colours I'm suspecting some mimicry with jumping jack ants. An excellent defence strategy if true. 12mm long.

item.title: Leucopsina odyneroides
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description: Seemed to be sleeping. About 12mm long, this one was generally fatter than previous finds.

item.title: Odontomyia spp.
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description: Small vivid flower feeders. Soldier flies. Stratiomyidae.

item.title: Sarcophaga spp.
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description: These flies resemble the snail parasite Tachinids but are smaller with non metallic colours and have lines on the thorax. (?Sarcophaga aurifrons)

item.title: Platystomatidae spp.
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description: Several of these were hiding in the large crevices of a coarse barked eucalyptus. About 20mm long overall. Still searching for this one. Bombyliidae

item.title: Sinpunctiptilia emissalis
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description: Found near the public library... so maybe a quill moth rather than a plume moth.

item.title: Muscidae spp.
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description: A small fly (body about 10mm long) with reduced tucked abdomen, shiny thorax, brown eyes... Muscidae according to TonyD on BowerBird

item.title: Platystomatidae spp.
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description: This is not Platystomatidae according to Tony from Tasmania " Likely a Rivellia species (we have very similar looking in Tasmania), though would need a closer view of the wing venation to be more certain. (No Pogonortalis have a wing pattern like this.) " The only other images I can find of this one are from Suzanne Jones http://natureshare.org.au/observations/53df1765e35eb16d3d000006 and also here http://www.bowerbird.org.au/observations/19369

item.title: Stomorhina spp.
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description: Fabulous folding mouth parts. Nice weird eyes. About 13mm long, Feeding on Leptospermum flowers in Wicks Reserve.

item.title: Leucopsina odyneroides
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description: A fabulous wasp mimic and parasitiser of spiders.

item.title: Tachinidae spp.
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description: Cup-moth parasite fly. About 9 months earlier I found a moth cocoon which was slightly unusual in size, colour and location so I decided to grow it out. Today shock, horror and delight when a prickly looking fly opened the lid, climbed out and stretched it's wings. On a Grevillea stem growing closely entwined with a small eucalyptus tree in a local nature reserve. Victim was Doratifera vulnerans - Mottled Cup Moth This one is Tachinidae probably Winthemia genus.

item.title: Scaptia maculiventris
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description: A large, noisy fly which stay within a metre of ground level so I let one settle on my steel capped boot. About 19mm long. Couldn't bite through the boot. In a local orchid reserve. Baluk Williams Flora Reserve. family: TABANIDAE subfamily: Pangoniinae tribe: Scionini

item.title: Microtropesa sinuata
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description: A large fly with about 30mm wingspan. Solitary and apparently searching for something around the base of a large eucalyptus. A species I haven't seen before. Glenfern valley nature reserve. This one is a male. The females are quite colourful with a lot of yellow/gold and white patterns underneath. The larvae of these flies are specialist parasitics on Hemipterans (true bugs)

item.title: Pipinnipons chauncyvallis
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description: About 18mm long, looked like a very twitchy wasp or ant searching crevices in timber retaining wall, almost invisible transparent wings, orange legs, very short fly-like antennae. Suburban back yard. Family: Therevidae (Stiletto flies) subfamily: Agapophytinae

item.title: Pelecorhynchus flavipennis
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description: A very large fly - 35mm long from wing tips (at rest) to antennae, mostly furry, large black eyes, orange antennae, black thorax with two fine yellow lines, large yellow halteres, stout vacuum-cleaner mouth part, long legs with black femurs and all yellow tibia/tarsi, dark yellow heavily veined wings with black markings, abdomen not seen as it was well covered by the wings. Resting on suburban footpath. This one needs to be compared to the giant spider wasp for Batesian mimicry.

item.title: Leucopsina odyneroides
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description: This fly is so similar to a 'potter wasp', which appears at the same time of year, that I think there must be some mimicry relationship. Body length about 10mm. Small head with all-encompassing eyes. High domed thorax. Very large calypters. On Leptospermum or Kunzea sp. flowers at the edge of a local national park. This critter parasitises spiders.

item.title: Evansomyia phyciformis
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description: A really tidy looking slim fly which superficially resembles some of the ichneumon or braconid wasps around the area. About 20mm long. Batesian mimicry.

item.title: Rutilia rubriceps
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description: A large fly about 18mm long body length. Quite intimidating when buzzing around my head at high speed and it was very aware of someone with a camera. On a large old log in a local nature reserve. Cardinia.

item.title: Rutilia agalmiodes
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description:
A large fly about 18mm long body length. Quite intimidating when buzzing around my head at high speed and it was very aware of someone with a camera. On a large rock in a local nature reserve. Cardinia.
Rutilia agaimiodes

item.title: Rutilia spp.
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description: A robust, metallic green and tan tachinid fly. About 22mm long overall. Resting on a bench in a local nature reserve adjoining national park. Species name not yet known.

item.title: Rutilia (Donovanius) regalis
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description: A very large, heavy bodied fly about 24mm long with a few coarse hairs towards rear; mostly grey with some hints of maroon. Resting on the bark of eucalyptus in nature reserve. (Rutilia (Donovanius) regalis not in taxo)

item.title: 23 ids
item.dc:creator: argybee
item.description: Species list for collection.
